text: Hi, I'm your virtual agent. I can help answer your questions, understand your benefits, and find further help.

text.text: tell me about The Indigenous Transportation Initiatives Fund

text: The Indigenous Transportation Initiatives Fund (ITIF) is an application-based funding program open to Indigenous communities and organizations interested in pursuing transportation-related projects.

text.text: Can you give me a list of benefits for students?

text: The Ontario Student Grant, Ontario Part-Time Grant and the Ontario Indigenous Travel Grant are non-repayable grant funding issued to support eligible students attending approved postsecondary institutions.

text.text: Tell me more about Ontario Indigenous Travel Grant

text: The Ontario Indigenous Travel Grant is a non-repayable grant funding issued to support eligible students attending approved postsecondary institutions.

text.text: Are there more details? Is there a link?

text: The Ontario Indigenous Travel Grant is a non-repayable grant funding issued to support eligible students attending approved postsecondary institutions. For more information, please visit the Ontario Government website.

text.text: tell me about Aboriginal Participation Fund

text: The Aboriginal Participation Fund is a program that provides funding to First Nations communities, M�tis communities, and Indigenous organizations to support their participation in the mineral development process. The program has four sub-streams: the values mapping and related projects sub-stream, the mineral development advisor (MDA) stream, the early exploration support sub-stream, and the advanced exploration and development support sub-stream.

text.text: tell me about mineral development advisor

text: The mineral development advisor (MDA) stream provides funding for a MDA for eligible Aboriginal communities and organizations to participate effectively in the regulatory consultation processes, including the review of: * exploration plan and permit applications * closure plans and closure plan amendments * environmental assessments This funding helps to increase a community�s knowledge and understanding of the mineral development sequence, mineral exploration, mineral development, and the regulatory process.

text.text: I am under 20years old, are there internship programs for me?

text: I'm sorry, I couldn't find any internship programs for individuals under 20 years old. However, there are a few internship programs available for groups or organizations. You can find more information on the Ontario Government website.

text.text: what about the Internship Program at the Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry

text: The Internship Program at the Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry offers paid internships to students who are interested in natural resource management. Interns work on projects that support natural resource management, receive mentoring, coaching and learning opportunities, and develop valuable professional contacts.
The Internship Program at the Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry offers a 12-month contract.

text.text: is there a link to more information?

text: The Internship Program at the Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry offers a 12-month contract. For more information, please visit the Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry website.
